intro: Agapanthus umbellatus var. aureus, commonly known as the golden agapanthus, is a striking perennial plant native to southern Africa. It features dense, spherical clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant has strap-like, evergreen leaves that form a rosette at the base. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
